actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.R. 5009 (Rep. Joyce):
        A bill to reauthorize wildlife habitat and conservation programs, and for other purposes.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
 

 S.Amdt. 3294 (Sen. Carper):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 3294 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Carper.

        --Amendment SA 3294 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 H.R. 6513 (Rep. Carey):
        A bill to amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to confirm the requirement that States allow access to designated congressional election observers to observe the election administration procedures in congressional elections.

        -- Senate Committee on Rules and Administration discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 3297 (Sen. McConnell):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 3297 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator McConnell.

        --Amendment SA 3297 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 H.R. 9106 (Rep. Lawler):
        A bill to direct the Director of the United States Secret Service to apply the same standards for determining the number of agents required to protect Presidents, Vice Presidents, and major Presidential and Vice Presidential candidates, and for other purposes.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S. 91 (Sen. Hagerty):
        A bill to award a Congressional Gold Medal to 60 diplomats, in recognition of their bravery and heroism during the Holocaust.

        -- Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 3295 (Sen. Hagerty):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 3295 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Hagerty.

        --Amendment SA 3295 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S. 815 (Sen. Tester):
        A bill to award a Congressional Gold Medal to the female telephone operators of the Army Signal Corps, known as the "Hello Girls".

        -- Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 3296 (Sen. Tester):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 3296 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Tester.

        --Amendment SA 3296 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S.Res. 812 (Sen. Hassan):
        A resolution supporting the designation of September 20, 2024, as "National Concussion Awareness Day".

        -- Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 847 (Sen. Durbin):
        A resolution honoring Wadee Alfayoumi, a 6-year-old Palestinian-American boy, murdered as a victim of a hate crime for his Palestinian-Muslim identity, in the State of Illinois.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 848 (Sen. Klobuchar):
        A resolution designating the week of September 23 through September 27, 2024, as "National Hazing Awareness Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 849 (Sen. Cassidy):
        A resolution calling on Congress, schools, and State and local educational agencies to recognize the significant educational implications of dyslexia that must be addressed, and designating October 2024 as "National Dyslexia Awareness Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 850 (Sen. Blackburn):
        A resolution designating October 2024 as "National Country Music Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 851 (Sen. Hoeven):
        A resolution designating November 2, 2024, as "National Bison Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 852 (Sen. Manchin):
        A resolution designating October 20, 2024, as "National Early Childhood Literacy Awareness Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 853 (Sen. Moran):
        A resolution expressing support for recognizing September 20 as National Service Dog Day.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 854 (Sen. Schumer):
        A resolution to authorize testimony and representation in United States v. Kelley.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 855 (Sen. Schumer):
        A resolution to authorize testimony and representation in United States v. Cudo.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
